Macaws

Yellow-Collared Macaw

A popular mini-macaw, mostly green with a distinctive bright yellow band on the back of its neck that develops with age. They have a black forehead and a reddish belly patch.

Origin
Central & South America
Size
15 inches (38 cm). Weight: 250-280g (8.8-9.9 oz)
Weight
265g avg.
Noise Level
Loud for their size. They have a high-pitched, piercing call that can be quite repetitive when they want something.

Looking for a Yellow-Collared Macaw?

See Available Yellow-Collared Macaw Listings

Temperament & Personality

Intelligent, curious, and mischievous. They are known for being very playful and can be affectionate, but they also have a stubborn streak and can be nippy.

Vocalization & Talking Ability

Very good talkers. They can develop a clear vocabulary of words and are known for their ability to learn tricks and mimic sounds.

Dietary Needs

A balanced diet consisting of high-quality pellets, fresh vegetables, leafy greens, and a limited amount of fruit and nuts.

Health & Lifespan

Can live for 50+ years. A hardy species. Prone to feather plucking if bored. They need plenty of chewable toys to keep their beaks in good condition.

Housing Requirements

Needs a roomy cage, minimum 30"W x 24"D x 36"H. Their potential for noise makes them a challenging, but not impossible, choice for apartments.

More Macaws

Blue and Gold Macaw

Very Loud. Their vocalizations are powerful and can be heard from long distances. They are prone to loud screaming, especially in the morning and evening.

Blue-Headed Macaw

Moderate. Their call is higher-pitched and less grating than large macaws, making them a quieter option, though they can still be noisy.

Blue-Throated Macaw

Loud. They have a loud macaw call, but it's generally considered to be less harsh and frequent than that of a Blue and Gold or Scarlet Macaw.
